reviews.review_msg: Passionate professor who does a good job explaining concepts. Term papers are quite detailed and complicated, so make sure to read the guidelines. Overall an awesome prof. Makes a boring class fun.

tottaly just makes up stats and other BS to make you thing about what may really not be the truth. She also says "yeah" a whole lot, get use to it because it will get annoying to you trust me !!! dont take her you will feel very very lost!!

I have had her for both criminology 213 and criminology 101.  She's an amazing prof, extremely organized, nice, approachable and clear.  It's not that the material itself is easy (it's university), her teaching style just makes it easy!

Camilla is a great teacher. she is super cute and tries hard to ensure that everyone gets the material.the exams are totally easy(our class average was 80%);i only used the text wen she made references to certain pages that were important;TA Annmarie is great- very helpful.the assignment n paper were easy (mostly opinion based).

Camilla is a very friendly professor. Lecture materials are fun and interesting. This course is good because it encourages you to think about the issues rather than memorizing. The assignments are all all right.  This is one of the best CRIM classes I took at SFU.
awsome teacher, EXTREMELY nice..exams were really easy. Assignments were not that easy but they were do-able.. Overall, great class and and even better teacher!
She was so approachable, and so cute, just the way she'd say stuff, i really enjoyed her class. Exams were fair.
Camilla is great, she's such a sweetheart. She's well organized and very helpful. Show up to class, copy the notes and some more and you'll ace the class.
Awesome, VERY nice, very helpful, fair tests, very very approachable. Clear, interested and interesting.

The only reason I took this class was because she was teaching it. I absolutely LOVE her teaching style (notes & lectures are very clear & organised) & her tests are fair (no suprises). You can tell she loves what she teaches. By far the best teacher I've taken at SFU! Take any of her classes and you'll see what I mean.

Camilla is a great prof. She is very accomadating to her students. All her lectures are recorded and the overheads are all online which is very helpful! Her classes are easy to follow, not boring. Exams are fair. Not super easy, but not rediculously hard either, they're fair. I would definitely recommend her. I would take another one of her courses

(ahhh, camilla. you've won my heart!) lectures were well organized, provided with webCT notes and digitally audio recorded. camilla was available always for clarifying whatever it is you need and for help. i'd definitely take another course taught by her.
